scenario:
Amazon's stock has had a strong 2024 with a nearly 50% increase, but its ability to repeat this performance in 2025 is uncertain. The company has multiple business segments, including e-commerce, advertising services, and Amazon Web Services (AWS). 

Amazon's advertising services have been its fastest-growing segment, with $14.3 billion in ad revenue in Q3, up 19% year over year. This segment is expected to continue growing, with healthy profit margins similar to those of other advertising giants like Meta Platforms and Alphabet. 

AWS has also seen a significant increase in growth, driven by demand from artificial intelligence (AI) workloads. Amazon's partnership with Anthropic and investment in the Claude generative AI model have contributed to this growth, with AWS growing 19% year over year in Q3 and posting an operating margin of 38%. 

For 2025, Wall Street analysts expect revenue to grow by 10.8% and earnings per share (EPS) to rise 20%. However, the stock currently trades at 36 times 2025 earnings, which is considered pricey. Despite this, Amazon's growth prospects over the next few years may justify the high valuation.
